metadata.title: CVE-2022-0854 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s DMA subsystem, in theway a user calls DMA_FROM_DEVICE. This flaw allows a local user to readrandom memory from the kernel space.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1125-kvm - 4.15.0-1125.130
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1139-aws - 4.15.0-1139.150
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1085-aws - 5.4.0-1085.92~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1149-azure - 4.15.0-1149.164
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1091-azure - 5.4.0-1091.96~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1134-gcp - 4.15.0-1134.150
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1089-gcp - 5.4.0-1089.97~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1033-ibm - 5.4.0-1033.37~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1104-oracle - 4.15.0-1104.115
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1083-oracle - 5.4.0-1083.91~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-191.202').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1125.130').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1139.150').
